title: [$150] Use `X` icon for closing the Concierge RHP instead of chevron

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Slack Thread Context: https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C090U774ZH7/p1767385544707019?thread_ts=1767385544.707019&cid=C090U774ZH7 **What the problem is:** The Concierge right-hand panel (RHP) currently displays a left-facing chevron/back-arrow as the close control. The thread concluded this is unintuitive because the Concierge panel is an open/close panel (not a navigation hierarchy), so a back-arrow suggests navigation rather than a simple close action. **What the expected output is:** The Concierge RHP should present an 'X' close control on desktop to clearly indicate open/close behavior. Other RHPs that represent hierarchical navigation should retain the back-arrow/chevron. **Debugging info:** - Observed current state: other RHPs use a left-facing chevron; Concierge also uses a chevron. - Team consensus in thread: Concierge is not navigational and should use an 'X' instead of a chevron. - No PRs, logs, or additional technical artifacts were referenced in the discussion. **Solution:** - Replace the left-facing chevron/back-arrow with an 'X' icon for the Concierge RHP Created with the :create-gh-issue: automation Screenshot:

title: [$250] [Unreported] Create per diem expenses in selfDM

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
# Part of the **Support the unreported expense flow in NewDot** project Main issue: https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/495162 Doc section: Project: https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/495162 # Feature Description This enables moving the unreported Per diem expenses from selfDM to a report # Manual Test Steps The following scenarios will be tested: ### No workspace has per diems enabled 1. Have an account with no workspace with per diems enabled 2. Verify that you can't create a per diem expense in selfDM ### Only one workspace has per diems enabled 1. Have an account that has one workspace with per diems enabled 2. Verify that you can create a per diem expense in selfDM 3. Verify that you don't have to pick a workspace; the one with per diems enabled is automatically taken into consideration (exactly how it works from Global Create) ### Multiple workspaces with per diems enabled 1. Have an account that has multiple workspaces with per diems enabled 2. Verify that you can create a per diem expense in selfDM 3. Verify that you first have to pick a workspace (similar to how it works from Global Create) # Automated Tests NOTE: We have a [draft PR](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/78109) open by @koko57 who's ooo right now. Here's its status:
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @

body:
Parent issue: https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/70187 We already added a Travel feature card on the Workspace More Features page to enable Travel per workspace. Now we want to add Expensify Travel to the "What features are you interested in" page alongside other workspace toggles. To achieve that we need: 1. BE update `CreateWorkspace` API to accept `isTravelEnabled: boolean` in `features`. @fedirjh could you please take a look since you worked on this feature before? 2. FE add Travel option to the "What features are you interested in" page.

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.92-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/77623 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2250@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome (Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. 1. Open the staging.new.expensify.com website. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Create two manual expenses on two different reports. 4. Navigate to "Reports" > "Expenses" 5. Turn off internet connection. 6. Select one of the just created expenses. 7. Click on the dropdown menu and select "Merge" 8. Select the second expense. 9. Keep all the details of the second expense and merge the expenses. 10. Note that infinite loading is experienced when the merging process is finished. ## Expected Result: After merging expenses while on "Reports", user should be correctly navigated to the report of the kept expense and all the details should be visible. ## Actual Result: After merging expenses while offline on "Expenses" section on "Reports", infinite loading is experienced when report of the kept expense opens. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dc066f78-5534-409c-813d-177b8881b25a [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: Remove most references to `NetworkStore.getAuthToken()`

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
# Problem
There are a lot of action files that use `getAuthToken()` and then add the auth token manually to the API parameters (perfect example [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/4074a7cf3aeb778c4ceca6d278a8e46335a101fe/src/libs/actions/Card.ts#L456)). This is an anti-pattern because the auth token is already added to the proper API commands further down in the network library [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/4074a7cf3aeb778c4ceca6d278a8e46335a101fe/src/libs/Network/enhanceParameters.ts#L60).

# Solution
Find all the references to `getAuthToken()` that can be removed, remove them, and ensure that the API commands still work properly.

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @tgolen</details>

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.90-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/76701 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ndk.2303+171@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Critical User Impact **Device used:** Windows 11 Home/Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Log in to the same account on OD and ND. - Account has a workspace. - The Individual WS is set as the default on OD. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to Reports > Expenses. 3. Go to OD with the same account. 4. In OD Create a reported scan expense. 5. Go back to ND tab and wait for the scan expense to show up. 6. While the receipt is still scanning, go back to OD and unreported the scan expense. 7. Go to ND, in Reports > Expenses page, click on the scan expense ## Expected Result: Scan expense details page is opened ## Actual Result: 'It's not here' page is opened ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b8cf0fba-d936-4a6b-8c3a-0e38a74bb5a9 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

  • Upwork Job ID: 2008261433800129740
  • Last Price Increase: 2026-01-05

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** V9.2.90-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13177080/test-cases/48358512 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** dreamnitethedragon+yydyd373@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Redminote 10S Android 13 **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: Pre-condition Invite a phone number user with admin role Add a fully verified bank account VBA 1. Launch app 2. Go to workspace settings 3. Tap workflows 4. Tap Payer 5. Select phone number user ## Expected Result: Authorized payer must not be displayed as phone number@expensify.sms ## Actual Result: Authorized payer is displayed as phone number@expensify.sms. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3a60446e-6ced-4c6c-a37d-b635af969e0b [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
